t: Psalm 147
Praise to God for His Word and Providence
Praise*pn the Lord!*s For*ld it*i is*i good to sing praises to our God; For*ld it*i is*i pleasant, and*i praise is beautiful.
The*ln Lord*s builds up Jerusalem; He*ld gathers together the outcasts of Israel.
He*ld heals the brokenhearted And*ld binds up their wounds.
He*ld counts the number of the stars; He*ld calls them all by name.
Great*ld is*i our Lord, and mighty in power; His*ld understanding is*i infinite.
The*ld Lord*s lifts up the humble; He*ld casts the wicked down to the ground.
Sing*ln to the Lord*s with thanksgiving; Sing*ld praises on the harp to our God,
Who*ld covers the heavens with clouds, Who*ld prepares rain for the earth, Who*ld makes grass to grow on the mountains.
He*ld gives to the beast its food, And*ild to the young ravens that cry.
He*ln does not delight in the strength of the horse; He*ld takes no pleasure in the legs of a man.

Praise*ln the Lord,*s O Jerusalem! Praise*ld your God, O Zion!
For*ld He has strengthened the bars of your gates; He*ld has blessed your children within you.

He*ld has not dealt thus with any nation; And*ld as*i for*i His*i judgments, they have not known them. Praise*ln the Lord!*s
